intro: Loxostylis alata, commonly known as the winged antelope plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its distinctive winged stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing a high degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are often narrow and grayish-green, adapted to reduce water loss. Loxostylis alata is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
